snippet: The White House chided the acting director of the Drug Enforcement Administration for saying that increased police scrutiny might be forcing officers to be less aggressive when enforcing laws.
abstract: White House sharply rejects assertion by Drug Enforcement Administration acting Chief Chuck Rosenberg that crime is rising across nation as police are reigning in aggression out of fear of being accused of police brutality; government's retort echoes criticism aimed at similar assertion made by FBI director James Comey in October.
lead_paragraph: The White House chided the acting director of the Drug Enforcement Administration for saying that increased police scrutiny might be forcing officers to be less aggressive when enforcing laws.

headline.main: White House Is Irked Again by Comments About Police
headline.print_headline: White House Is Irked Again by Comments About Police
